snippet: A group of students took over the administration building at the University of California campus here early today, protesting the ballot measure approved last week that eliminates race-  and sex-based preferences in state programs and institutions...
lead_paragraph: A group of students took over the administration building at the University of California campus here early today, protesting the ballot measure approved last week that eliminates race- and sex-based preferences in state programs and institutions. Twenty arrests were made. The noisy but peaceful protest by about 150 people broke up in the early afternoon after Chancellor Raymond L. Orbach met twice with the demonstrators and assured them that the school would continue to promote diversity.
abstract: Group of students takes over administration building at University of California campus at Riverside, in protest against passage of state referendum outlawing affirmative action (S)

headline.main: California Students Take Over a Building
